title: Urinary Protein Excretion Estimation
desc: The Urinary Protein Excretion Estimation quantifies 24-hour proteinuria using protein/creatinine ratio from a single urine sample.

orgreference.text: Ginsberg JM, Chang BS, Matarese RA, Garella S. Use of single voided urine samples to estimate quantitative proteinuria. N Engl J Med. 1983 Dec 22;309(25):1543-6.

other_refer.text: Siwach SB, Kalra OP, Sharma R, Singh V, Chopra JS. Estimation of 24 hour protein excretion from single random urine specimen. Indian J Med Res. 1990 Apr;92:105-8.
Schwab SJ, Christensen RL, Dougherty K, Klahr S. Quantitation of proteinuria by the use of protein-to-creatinine ratios in single urine samples. Arch Intern Med. 1987 May;147(5):943-4.
Houser M. Assessment of proteinuria using random urine samples. J Pediatr. 1984 Jun;104(6):845-8.
Neithardt AB, Dooley SL, Borensztajn J. Prediction of 24-hour protein excretion in pregnancy with a single voided urine protein-to-creatinine ratio. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 2002;186(5):883-6.

data.evidence:
24-hour Urinary Protein Excretion Estimation = Urine Protein / Urine Creatinine

Urine protein/creatinine ratio in mg per g approximates protein excretion in mg per 24 hours.
data.facts:
Interpretation:

UPEE <0.2 g/day

Within normal limits

UPEE 0.2–3.5 g/day

Investigate further

UPEE >3.5 g/day

Nephrotic range
can_search: Spot Urine Protein to Urine Creatinine Ratio
